summary: The Middle Market IPO Cost Act directs the Comptroller General of the United States to study the costs associated with small- and medium-sized companies undertaking initial public offerings (IPOs). The study will examine direct and indirect IPO costs, compare them to alternative financing options, analyze their impact on capital formation, retail investor access, and IPO trends. A report containing findings and recommendations is to be issued to Congress within 360 days of the Act's enactment.
